transcriptText:
Taking inspiration from the Tamil karlakattai, the exercises in this program will bring a new dimension to your club swinging!

All the exercises are done as ”hand to hand”, meaning that we switch grips each repetition.

On top of full body strength, endurance and well being, you can expect to develop fantastic levels of coordination, timing, dexterity and flow.

This video course is intended for people who have some experience with Indian clubs/ clubbells, as we cover complex patterns and exercises involving shoulder, elbow and wrist joints, all done in multiple planes of motion.

WHY YOU SHOULD SWING INDIAN CLUBS

Gently mobilizes the shoulders, elbows and wrists and improve range of motion

Strengthens the shoulder girdle and grip ( muscles and connective tissues) in its full range of motion

Consists of compound movements in multiple planes

Provides low impact cardiovascular exercise

Assists recovery from intense training

Improves the 3 pillars of physical literacy (body control , locomotion and object control)

It is fun and you forget you are training.

The rhythmic and repetitive patterns are highly meditative and calm the nervous system, like meditation.

Cross crawl exercises and other challenging moves improve learning capacity and stimulate neurogenesis, the creation of new brain cells.

❂ HEROIC SPORT | AN ANCIENT SPORT

Our clubs are easily adjustable, which is a modern twist on the ancient traditional Indian clubs used to train Tamil and Persian warriors.

Indian clubs were used in Europe and USA for remedial gymnastics in the 18th and 19th century, by pioneers of physiotherapy.

❂ READY TO LEARN MORE?

All our educational material has been tested and structured since 2010, in a way that is easy for anyone to learn from home.

Best regards from Thierry & Ron

[Music] hey it's terry from rocksport and i want to tell you a bit about our program the ace of clubs so it's a program designed for a single heavy indian club perfect for the excel the tg or kalakatai but if you've got nothing else two palette vandals and a bottle filled with sand will give you you know a good run for your money now we are doing advanced club swinging exercise and we're performing them hand to hand which means we're going to switch hands from repetition to repetition okay so there is a lot of challenge involving your dexterity and coordination but overall it's a great strength training program and also good for well-being okay we're going to swing the clubs in all planes of motion so that means in front of the body behind the body but the side of the body across diagonally and horizontally uh we are going to involve all three joints so not only the shoulder the elbow but also the wrist and i'm going to take you through the step-by-step uh tutorials of each of the 14 exercises now this time to complement the club swinging exercise we added a traditional exercise that people love or hate it's called the burpee i show you different options and also show you how to perform this apache which is the hindu wrestling version 10 variations plus five variations if you're inclined to using dumbbells or kettlebells while training at home like in many of our other programs we are using variability in the ace of clubs which means that you're never going to be doing the exact same program this time to figure out some of the parameters in the training sessions we are using a deck of cards we're going to of course do the classic deck of card workouts but we'll also more ways of how you can structure your training program and using the cast to figure out some of the randomness that we love while working on the same club exercise so you improve your skills

![Thumbnail (1920x1080)](https://i.ytimg.com/vi_webp/zeu62CvL0t0/maxresdefault.webp)
# [The Ace of Clubs program for heavy clubs, mudgars & clubbells](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zeu62CvL0t0)

**Visibility**: Public
**Uploaded by**: [Heroic Sport - Indian clubs workouts](http://www.youtube.com/@HeroicSport)
**Uploaded at**: 2021-03-15T00:15:03-07:00
**Published at**: 2021-03-15T00:15:03-07:00
**Length**: 02:14
**Views**: 2167
**Likes**: 50
**Category**: Sports

## Description

```
Taking inspiration from the Tamil karlakattai, the exercises in this program will bring a new dimension to your club swinging!
All the exercises are done as ”hand to hand”, meaning that we switch grips each repetition.
☛ GET IT HERE ☛ https://heroicsport.com/product/ace-of-clubs-advanced-heavy-club-exercises-for-karlakattai-mudgars-clubbells/

On top of full body strength, endurance and well being, you can expect to develop fantastic levels of coordination, timing, dexterity and flow.
This video course is intended for people who have some experience with Indian clubs/ clubbells, as we cover complex patterns and exercises involving shoulder, elbow and wrist joints, all done in multiple planes of motion.

WHY YOU SHOULD SWING INDIAN CLUBS
〄 PHYSICAL ASPECTS
Gently mobilizes the shoulders, elbows and wrists and improve range of motion
Strengthens the shoulder girdle and grip ( muscles and connective tissues) in its full range of motion
Consists of compound movements in multiple planes
Provides low impact cardiovascular exercise
Assists recovery from intense training
Improves the 3 pillars of physical literacy (body control , locomotion and object control)
〄 MENTAL ASPECTS
It is fun and you forget you are training.
The rhythmic and repetitive patterns are highly meditative and calm the nervous system, like meditation.
Cross crawl exercises and other challenging moves improve learning capacity and stimulate neurogenesis, the creation of new brain cells.

❂ HEROIC SPORT | AN ANCIENT SPORT 
We have created the Pahlavandle ™ and the Pahlavandle™XL to make it affordable for everyone to discover the benefits of swinging clubs.
Our clubs are easily adjustable, which is a modern twist on the ancient traditional Indian clubs used to train Tamil and Persian warriors. 
Indian clubs were used in Europe and USA for remedial gymnastics in the 18th and 19th century, by pioneers of physiotherapy.

❂ READY TO LEARN MORE?
We run instructor certifications (online and live), team building events and offer video downloads on our website at https://heroicsport.com/indian-clubs-online/
All our educational material has been tested and structured since 2010, in a way that is easy for anyone to learn from home.

❂ FOLLOW US ON INSTAGRAM https://www.instagram.com/heroic.sport/
Best regards from Thierry & Ron
```

## Transcript

[Music] hey it's terry from rocksport and i want to tell you a bit about our program the ace of clubs so it's a program designed for a single heavy indian club perfect for the excel the tg or kalakatai but if you've got nothing else two palette vandals and a bottle filled with sand will give you you know a good run for your money now we are doing advanced club swinging exercise and we're performing them hand to hand which means we're going to switch hands from repetition to repetition okay so there is a lot of challenge involving your dexterity and coordination but overall it's a great strength training program and also good for well-being okay we're going to swing the clubs in all planes of motion so that means in front of the body behind the body but the side of the body across diagonally and horizontally uh we are going to involve all three joints so not only the shoulder the elbow but also the wrist and i'm going to take you through the step-by-step uh tutorials of each of the 14 exercises now this time to complement the club swinging exercise we added a traditional exercise that people love or hate it's called the burpee i show you different options and also show you how to perform this apache which is the hindu wrestling version 10 variations plus five variations if you're inclined to using dumbbells or kettlebells while training at home like in many of our other programs we are using variability in the ace of clubs which means that you're never going to be doing the exact same program this time to figure out some of the parameters in the training sessions we are using a deck of cards we're going to of course do the classic deck of card workouts but we'll also more ways of how you can structure your training program and using the cast to figure out some of the randomness that we love while working on the same club exercise so you improve your skills


## Endscreen
    
- [Mugdar exercise workout (Mudgar /Clubbell) | Circular exercises with a kettlebell](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LyLM493QVI8)
- [Join the 21 day Heavy club challenge | Start here, it's free!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gh_9MsdV360)
